snippet: As hearings into the Boston bombings begin, the tenure of Robert S. Mueller III is facing new scrutiny, months from his plans to step down.
abstract: Tenure of Federal Bureau of Investigation director Robert S Mueller III is facing new scrutiny as hearings into Boston Marathon bombings begin, months from his longtime plans to step down in September; he is not a beloved figure in the FBI's beer-and-brats culture, but has always had supporters in both parties in Congress, and will now spend his final months answering tough questions about how bombing suspects went unnoticed.

byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

lead_paragraph: As hearings into the Boston bombings begin, the tenure of Robert S. Mueller III is facing new scrutiny, months from his plans to step down.

headline.seo: In Bombings, a Bitter Bookend for Robert Mueller
headline.main: Bombings Make a Bitter Bookend for F.B.I.’s Director
headline.print_headline: Bombings a Bitter Bookend for F.B.I.’s Director
